source: After the League Two side's bright start, two quick goals from Diafra Sakho and Andre Ayew gave the Premier League side control before half-time. Sakho slotted in his first goal since November from Sam Byram's pass, before Ayew tucked into the same bottom corner moments later. The hosts went close via Harry Pell's volley and Jordon Forster's header. James Collins and Byram both could have added further goals for the visitors, who made seven changes following top-flight losses at Manchester United and Southampton. The best moment for Cheltenham, who were unchanged from Saturday's 3-0 league defeat by Carlisle, came with Pell's low volley across goal, but onrushing substitute Dan Holman could not quite get the required touch as he slid in at the far post. The two sides' only previous meeting came at the same stage of this competition four years ago, resulting in a narrow 2-1 win for Hammers at their old home Upton Park. The fourth-tier side performed respectfully again on Wednesday, but did not sufficiently test Hammers goalkeeper Adrian. Slaven Bilic's side could have won by a greater margin, but Robins captain Kyle Storer cleared Angelo Ogbonna's fierce header off the line in the first half and, moments later, keeper Jonathan Flatt did well to stop Sakho turning in Ayew's low cross. Cheltenham's exit ended League Two's representation in the EFL Cup before Thursday's third-round draw. Match ends, Cheltenham Town 0, West Ham United 2. summary: In the EFL Cup match, West Ham United, a Premier League team, defeated League Two side Cheltenham Town 2-0. Diafra Sakho and Andre Ayew scored for West Ham before half-time, with assists from Sam Byram and a goal-less performance from Adrian in goal. Cheltenham Town came close on several occasions but failed to score, with their best chance coming from Harry Pell's volley. West Ham made seven changes following losses at Manchester United and Southampton, while Cheltenham were unchanged from their 3-0 league defeat by Carlisle. The two sides' only previous meeting was four years ago, resulting in a 2-1 win for West Ham at Upton Park. The victory ended League Two's representation in the EFL Cup before the third-round draw.

summary: Cheltenham Town, a League Two side, faced West Ham United in a match that ended with a 2-0 loss for the former. The game started with two quick goals from Diafra Sakho and Andre Ayew, giving the Premier League side control before half-time. Despite a close attempt by Harry Pell and a near miss by James Collins, Cheltenham Town failed to add more goals. West Ham United made seven changes following their top-flight losses at Manchester United and Southampton. The match saw a low volley from Pell and a header from Ayew, but Cheltenham Town's goalkeeper, Jonathan Flatt, managed to save both attempts. The match ended with Cheltenham Town's exit from the EFL Cup, marking their last appearance in the competition.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

West Ham United defeated Cheltenham Town 2-0 in an EFL Cup match. The Premier League side took control with two quick first-half goals from Diafra Sakho and Andre Ayew. Cheltenham, a League Two team, had a bright start but couldn't sufficiently test West Ham's goalkeeper. The hosts had a few chances, including Harry Pell's volley and Jordon Forster's header, but couldn't convert. West Ham could have increased their lead, with James Collins and Sam Byram missing opportunities. This was only the second meeting between the two sides in this competition, with West Ham winning the previous encounter 2-1 four years ago. Cheltenham's exit marked the end of League Two's representation in the EFL Cup before the third-round draw.

Cheltenham had some chances but couldn't convert, and West Ham could've increased their lead if not for a goal-line clearance and a good save. The result eliminated League Two's presence in the competition before the third-round draw.

Slaven Bilic's side could have won by a greater margin, but Robins captain Kyle Storer cleared Angelo Ogbonna's fierce header off the line in the first half and, moments later, keeper Jonathan Flatt did well to stop Sakho turning in Ayew's low cross. West Ham United defeated Cheltenham Town 2-0 in the EFL Cup, with Diafra Sakho and Andre Ayew scoring in the first half. Cheltenham, a League Two side, started brightly but were unable to capitalize on their chances, with Harry Pell and Jordon Forster coming close to scoring. The win ended League Two's representation in the EFL Cup, with Cheltenham exiting the competition.

Cheltenham had a few chances to score, but ultimately could not get past West Ham goalkeeper Adrian. West Ham made seven changes to their lineup after losing to Manchester United and Southampton in the Premier League.

Despite Cheltenham's efforts, including a close volley from Harry Pell, they couldn't sufficiently challenge West Ham's goalkeeper. West Ham, who made seven changes after recent losses, could have extended their lead but were denied by Cheltenham's defense. The match ended with Cheltenham's exit from the competition, marking the end of League Two's representation in the EFL Cup.
